Description: Arsenical copper axe-head: the cutting end is undamaged and can be seen to be slightly splayed and to have a concave edge. The original shape of the socket has been distorted by blows, which also caused cracks in the ribbed edges. One of the front spurs is truncated and both the rear spurs are damaged. The piece is thickly corroded in parts. Remains of the original wooden haft survive in the corrosion product inside the socket.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell el-Yahudiya (said to have come from)
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (168)
Condition: incomplete - haft missing, partly oxidised, spurs damaged
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
